item.title: Loom
item.description: Truly non-blocking asynchronous APIs rely on event loops and fine-tuned implementation techniques such as work stealing and drain loops in order to maximize CPU utilisation. But they rely on callbacks too, which leads to the infamous callback-hell that. TODO: Yup, rework this part, heavily. But we’re in 2019 so we have libraries now to lift this problem off of our shoulders, namely Reactive Streams libraries such as RxJava or Pivotal’s Project Reactor.
